S

setGoal() - Method in class spothunt.Cell
setGoal sets the goal boolean to true.
setGoals(GoalSpot[]) - Method in class spothunt.Playfield
setGoals is used to create the GoalSpots on the field, given an array of GoalSpots.
setLocation(int, int) - Method in class spothunt.GoalSpot
 
setLocation(int, int) - Method in class spothunt.MovingSpot
 
setLocation(int, int) - Method in class spothunt.Player
setLocation moves the Player to a new location, given an x and y.
setLocation(int, int) - Method in interface spothunt.Spot
setLocation moves the MovingSpot to a new location, given an x and y.
setupPlayfield(int, int) - Method in class spothunt.Playfield
setupPlayfield is used for initializing each cell of the 2D array (matrix) with the a new instance of the class Cell.
showPFValues(int) - Method in class spothunt.Playfield
This shows a text-based representation of the field understandable to users.
Given the options, it will either just show the plain danger levels per area, a very informative view per area or the danger levels and important components per area.
Set options 0 will result in the plain danger levels per area, for example:
Spot - Interface in spothunt
This interface takes care of the MovingSpot and GoalSpot.
